comment: Reese’s peanut butter candy and Orville Redenbacher popcorn on the nose, the same on the palate, also very viscous with a hint of burnt popcorn and macadamia nut liquor, sweet, syrupy short finish
Great tasting peanut butter whiskey.  I would recommend drinking on the rocks, or can be a great mixer.
There is a strong butterscotch flavor that balances well with the lighter peanut notes. Overly sweet and overpowering to any traditional whiskey flavorings. Would be a great mixer.

Hint of whiskey and then buttery nutty peanut butter and sugary taste.  It's definitely wayyyyyy better than Jack Daniel honey but too much of a good thing can be off putting.  Syrupy, great for couple of shots but might make you want to reach for water of you drink a whole glass.
There is a potent vanilla nose followed by flavors reminiscent of hydrox cookies. The peanut butter notes are subdued. This whiskey isn’t as sweet as I’d have expected.
Too sweet for me to really enjoy it
The butterscotch is a lot more potent than the actual peanut butter itself. Smooth when dipped but still has a strong aftertaste. Best on the rocks to mellow out the bold butter flavor.
Tasted a bit like Frangelica but with a bit more burn
very interesting with prominent peanut butter.  Would love to try this over ice cream or with cream soda.
Alcoholic caramel frappuchino...very sweet and must be watered down. Good as a drizzle over ice cream.

I am a traditional whisky drinker. Love all the staples. OWA. HM10. ECBP. etc. 

And I say this whiskey is fantastic. It makes zero sense. But it’s awesome. It somehow blends PB and whiskey in the best way. Fantastic to keep on hand and share with those friends that don’t love whiskey. Great to keep in the fridge or freezer and poured into a salt rimmed glass. Or mixed with chambord to make a PB&J.
this with chamborg (pb&j) changed my life
What an amazing flavor. Tastes like liquid peanut butter with a kick.
Nutty nose, bright and sweet-forward, warmth and a little burn trailing off into toasty peanut butter.

Holy freakin crap, that’s great!!! it’s like the whiskey you drink, after you drink your whiskey. Butterscotch on the nose, light but creamy middle. Perfect peanut butter finish. Sounds white trash but crazy good!
it's not real whisky or whiskey, but it is delicious

Quite fun after dinner drink! Not a daily drinker but definitely a fun conversation starter and night cap after dinner with friends.

Nose: Heavy butterscotch 
Palette: Butterscotch and peanuts
Mouth: creamy but light
Finish: peanut butter

My original thoughts is was that peanut butter and whiskey would not work. This is a very delicious whiskey. It has a very nice peanut butter aroma.  It is very smooth and a little creamy.  There is a heavy taste of peanut butter with hints of whiskey on the tail of tasting it.
Reeses peanut cup in a glass. Definitely sweet and salty but very good nonetheless
So this is a gimmick whiskey,  but if you like peanut butter,  then this absolutely nails the flavor.  Not a daily drinker,  but a fun addition to the bar.
Sweet, peanut buttery flavor great for cocktails with chocolate
Good replacement for simple syrup with pb flavor
As advertised. Clear taste of peanut butter and a very smooth whiskey. Rather good and easy to drink straight or on the rocks.
Caramel Popcorn, peanut butter, sweet corn
Caramel corn, peanuts and cracker jack. Its something else. Cant quite figure out what Im gonna do with it. Could make some awesome fall flavored drinks with it
If you like sweet liqueurs, this will be a 5-Star rating for you. Tastes like the milk at the end of a bowl of Reese’s Puffs Cereal. Creamy with butterscotch notes; almost zero alcohol bite.
Extremely smooth over rocks. Could find myself in a lot of trouble with this delicious beverage.
Super sweet. Really tastes like peanut butter.
It’s exactly as advertised. Definitely peanut butter, definitely whiskey. Low enough abv where there is no burn. Can’t wait to try it in a cocktail.
Definitely not what I was expecting; very smooth drinker chilled. Would consider this more a liqueur than a whiskey. Definitely would recommend to try it; it will surprise you. Worth the money!
OMG!!! if you like peanut butter, you need to drink this! Smooth, tasty and sweet

Bar sipping.
Lookie here... This is butterscotch whiskey plain and simple. Great idea, poor execution. I LOVE the idea of this and they will sell this to a TON of female drinkers, but i got only a hint of peanuts and a hint of whiskey. This is plain and simple a liquor... Delicious but not what i expected.

No surprise here! Nose of Peanut Butter, Buttercream Icing, and Movie Theater Popcorn Butter. Palate is super sweet. And when I say super sweet, I think I can feel Type II coming on after a couple sips. Chocolate and Peanut. Like a Reese Cup, but without the hint of saltiness to tie it all together. I was hoping for a saltier profile more akin to real Peanut Butter. I picked this one up strictly for Sh*** & Giggles to experiment with in some cocktails. My fear is that it may be hard to find something that will cut the cloying sweetness. As far as odd combinations go, this one works much better than the Dickel Tabasco Fiasco.
Very smooth and an interesting peanut butter after taste
It's a good flavored whiskey. If you like peanut butter cups then you'll probably love this whiskey.
Very sweet, will be interested to figure out if it can play nice in a cocktail.
As much as I hate admit it, damn it's pretty good.
Love peanut butter, you'll like this. I have not mixed. No need since I like peanut butter. Not going to buy again but not disappointed.

The best synthetic peanut butter flavor I've ever had. Peanut butter is one of my favorite flavors, so I've tried many peanut butter beers,they all seem to have that fake taste, with off flavors on the finish. This does not, just whiskey and sweet peanut butter married together in a great dessert whiskey.
Extremely oily mouth feel.   Overly peanut buttery.   Like drinking liquid peanut butter.
Synthetic caramel burnt popcorn with a peanut butter finish. Pass
Definitely tasted like whiskey, with a strong, sweet peanut butter finish. It wasn't bad, but not something I would sip on.
I don't care if this is declasse. This is liquid peanut butter. And literally if you love peanut butter, you will LOVE this.
Very sweet and very smooth. A fun simple twist on a traditional whiskey. Great in mixed drinks or straight up! You have to really like peanut butter, but if you do you will not regret this spirit
Little 2 sweet 4 me but 4 the price it's fun...
Thanks @Kyle-Metes-Randolph! This was a phenomenal nightcap :). Love it.

Look, don't go into this expecting anything fancy and you'll have a good time. It's like a Fast and the Furious movie. It's not here to change your life, just give you a good time. It's got a great chocolate-peanut butter smell on the nose and almost descends into a caramel popcorn taste. Very good whiskey.
Great whiskey! Very strong taste and smell in peanut butter. Very good by itself
With a couple scoops of vanilla ice cream maybe.
Don't know if I'd ever drink it straight but interesting and flavorful. Like a reese cup. Killer in coffee and hot chocolate

Only rated so high because I had low expectations. This is not great whiskey. In fact, if you like whiskey, you  won’t find much - except first hint on nose and color, that resembles your preferred drink. No real whiskey flavor. Absolutely no whiskey bite. HOWEVER, if you’re looking for a dessert drink that sort of resembles whiskey AND YOU LIKE PEANUT BUTTER, give this a try. You’ll find it to be really not bad at all for that purpose!
Sugar bomb up front but smooth finish with a very distinct peanut butter flavor. Lingers for quite a while with 0 burn. This could be the fireball killer for shooters

On the nose: Peanut butter
Taste: Peanut butter
Finish: Peanut butter

Thoughts: Tastes like peanut butter. 

Honestly not bad. I love peanut butter so when I heard this existed I needed to try it. It’s not to be taken too seriously. It’s tasty and fun.

4.25? Really????  Yes, BUT...

Screwball is labelled as a whiskey, but it's not (with all due respect to Screwball and their branding and marketing teams).  Like Drambuie, it's a whiskey-based liqueur.  It's syrupy and super sweet, like a peanut butter version of Licor 43.

For those who like peanut butter, have a serious sweet tooth, and prefer to keep the ABV low, this stuff has the potential to be very dangerous.  Liquid crack. It's simply bursting with a sweet peanut butter flavor, which is admirably achieved with natural flavoring.

For me, it's too sweet to drink straight.  While I can tolerate and even enjoy a high level of natural sweetness in a whiskey, this isn't even close.   

Nevertheless, I suspect it would be an excellent mixer.  I have yet to experiment, but I can see it being the basis for an Americanized version of a Rusty Nail (which is Scotch and Drambuie).  In this case, the ingredients could be bourbon and Skrewball.  Let's call it a Rusty Skrew!   Marketing genius, or is it just the Barrell Bourbon Batch 19 talking?  The peanut note in Beam products will never seem the same...
Silly but legit! Great for cocktails! Can be used as the solo spirit, or paired with more whisky!
Very smooth. Tastes like liquid peanut butter. I was pleasantly surprised.
Very surprising taste, it really does taste like peanut butter
Try mixing it with the 8 ball chocolate whiskey.
Super sweet liquor more than you avg whiskey.  Tastes great on its own as an after dinner supper.  Full of peanut butter brittle flavors.
I really thought I’d hate this, but for what it is, tastes awesome!
Really good with a lot of peanut butter flavor
Did not need to buy this one. It is what it is. Peanut butter caramel corn with praline/brittle. Super sweet. Makes a decent dessert type cocktail
Nutty caramel flavor with a little heat.
Mix with strawberry jelly purée and it tastes like a peanut-butter and jelly shot
Sweet notes of creamy peanut butter, great chilled on a cold night by a fire
I wouldn't drink this straight, but in a drink it is amazing!

A straightforward as advertised peanut butter experience.  Mr. Peanut salted, peanut brittle, hazelnut and chocolate from nose to palate to finish.  Mind you, if you are looking for a pure whisky experience, look elsewhere.  If you want a (super)sweet and salty ride, buckle up, throw your hands to the air and have fun.   @Scottyemo best describes the experience.  Have fun, play and mix. Add some Chambord.  Try it over ice. Try it with Bailey’s. Try it with ___.  Plain  and simple sweet fun.  For the price, worth the ride.
Fun for someone to try but kot serious drink. Strong peanut butter smell and taste is first caramel then peanut butter.
Syrup like with a heavy sweet peanut butter flavor. Great for a dessert cordial, but not something where I’d want a full glass.
Malted peanut butter smell. More nut butter taste than your expected peanut butter taste. You taste it more in the after taste. Initial taste is a bit syrupy/oily tasting.
Very sweet peanut buttery. Would be good in coffee. Definitely only a small quantity whiskey.
Great peanut butter flavor while still having a whiskey taste
Great peanut butter flavor, slightly sweet.
Way to sweet for my taste. It will be a good mixer with something just don’t know what yet.
Really easy drinking! No bite, sweet, tastes like a peanut butter and jelly sandwich. Dangerously good
Very sweet, with a slight peanut butter flavor. Nice flavor for those who would like a sweet treat to sip on. Yummy.

N: peanut butter, duh, maybe a touch of vanilla 
P: egads, super sweet, no burn, just liquid peanuts and more sweet sugar, maybe some honey as well
F: quickly passing peanuts, some lingering sugar and vanilla

We opened the bottle tonite for a birthday, I guess it’s not for me, and I like the Beam peanut brittle taste, but this was too much.  some of others enjoyed it, but I found I need a bit of burn and some oak
It's definitely a change from our normal bourbon, rye or corn whiskey. A bit sweet.  But tasty.
Good thing I tried a mini bottle of this instead of a full bottle.  It’s a super sweet peanut butter dessert. It’s more novelty drink than whiskey. I should have tried this one in coffee; maybe.
Take an average whiskey, pour honey or syrup into it, and you have this. A lot of honey and syrup. In fact just add whiskey to your honey or syrup (and a tbsp of Jiff) and you have this.
So it tastes sweet and goes down easy. I would maybe have a “desert drink” from it. Definitely not a regular sipper. Could imagine a deadly hangover! It was, however, really good in a cup of coffee
I wanted to hate it....but it’s actually a fun shooter
Caramel and sugar nose. Nutterbutter taste.
Soooooo sweet. Just sugar on top of sugar. No real whiskey burn or even taste. Just straight peanut butter. Ok, but probably more suited to dudebros doing shots at the bar
Peanut butter is the after taste, great for sipping or cocktails w/a jam. Would buy again
Smells incredible taste better I like it mixed with something a little to super sweet to drink very often.
It should be a liqueur, not a whiskey.

I don't usually seek out and drink flavored whiskey but this one peaked my curiosity.  It's like a spoon full of peanut butter with a shot of sweetener and drop of alcohol.  It's not for everyone and it's not really for me either.  I do look forward to finding other uses for it.  First,  I'll try it on vanilla or chocolate ice cream. Then,  I'll try a shot of it in an amber or stout beer.  It's a novelty and I'll use as just that.
So yummy! Made my first drink with hot chocolate and it was amazing!
Whether or not you are a whiskey lover, if you're a fan of peanut butter you'll love this bottle. Sweet and smooth, it appeals to a much broader audience than it let's on.
Not bad, good for shot every now and then.
I'm not really into sweet whiskey but this seemed like it was really well blended.
Tastes and smells like peanut butter. Too sweet and leaves a sugar syrup taste. Not for me.
Awful sweet like baileys with sugar added on top. Yuck!

NOSE: butter, peanut butter cookie, vanilla

MOUTH: so good, thick, sharp proof edges

FINISH: proof lingers, peanut butter tails off quickly

-dg
As a novelty drink it’s pretty good. Peanut butter all the way. I’m looking for a chocolate bar to pair with this right now.

Peanut butter. Cloying sweetness. Buttery. Sugar cookie. Very little, if any, whiskey flavor. This is more of a dessert whiskey than anything else. It has potential to be great as a mixer in a cocktail but I'd only want to drink a small amount of it neat. Somewhat reminiscent of Knob Creek Smoked Maple in this sense.

Could be great as a cordial or on top of dessert. Definitely peanut butter. Also reminds me of hot buttered movie popcorn. Very sweet with a little spice. Wife doesn’t like whiskey, but she loves this... of course
Not usually a fan of flavored whiskeys but this is like drinking straight peanut butter - you’d never know there was any alcohol and it’s not too sweet.
Nice and nutty. Great with chocolate whiskey for dessert
Not overpowering on the peanut butter, but delicious!
Definitely sweet and tastes of peanut better. Can tell there is some sugar added

Bought an airplane bottle just to try. Nose isn’t bad - caramel and hazelnut. Like Nutella. Thick and oily in the palate with peanut butter coming later. Way too sweet. I imagine for what they’re trying to do, it’s mission accomplished. But not something I’ll drink again.
Great dessert whiskey. Tastes like a Nut Roll.
Added a little disarono and almond milk. It was amazing.
Smoother than a 25 year old The Macallan.  Great flavor.  Really have nothing bad to say, and I tried.
Very sweet. Better than it sounds.
Sweet peanut butter flavor.  Mix with some grape juice for a pb&j taste.
Sweet. Syrupy. Peanut butter. Shockingly good.
Very good though you do feel it in your nose a bit
With a little water it brings out the peanut butter taste but overall a fair bottle if you like peanut butter flavor.
Very sweet, strong peanut flavor. Goes well with Chocolate liquors
Very good peanut butter flavor. Not too sweet or overwhelming. Used in a lot of mixed drinks.
Delicious. Tastes just like peanut butter. I mix it with Godiva chocolate liqueur to make a Reeces Peanut Butter cup drink.
Decent balance of peanuts and whiskey. Little too sweet. Surprisingly thick.
Good flavor, but I mostly got a coffee after taste. It was great in a PB&J old fashioned. 2 oz. Skrewball and 1 oz. your favorite rye whiskey.
Too sweet, very little peanut butter flavor and also very little whiskey flavor.
Smooth peanut butter, very sweet. Carmel notes. Goes very well on ice to sip.
Worst thing I’ve ever tasted in a bottle. Breakfast cereal fake peanut butter meets cheap whiskey.
